args.natural_language_statement: Let {x_n}_{n=1}^\infty be a convergent monotone sequence. Suppose there exists a k \in \mathbb{N} such that \lim_{n\to \infty} x_n = x_k . Show that x_n = x_k for all n \ge k.

retrieved_examples.nl: If a monotone increasing sequence in ‚Ñù converges to the value of one of its terms, then it is eventually constant equal to that term.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem monotone_tendsto_eq_of_eq_term {x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (k : ‚Ñï) (hmono : Monotone x) (ht : Tendsto x atTop (ùìù (x k))) : ‚àÄ n ‚â• k, x n = x k := by sorry

retrieved_examples.nl: A nonincreasing sequence that converges to one of its terms is eventually constant.
retrieved_examples.lean: theorem antitone_tendsto_eq_of_eq_term {x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (k : ‚Ñï) (hmono : Antitone x) (ht : Tendsto x atTop (ùìù (x k))) : ‚àÄ n ‚â• k, x n = x k := by sorry

import Mathlib
open Set
open Filter

/-- Let {x_n}_{n=1}^\infty be a convergent monotone sequence. Suppose there exists a k \in \mathbb{N} such that \lim_{n\to \infty} x_n = x_k . Show that x_n = x_k for all n \ge k. -/
theorem monotone_tendsto_eq_of_eq_term {x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù} (k : ‚Ñï) (hmono : Monotone x) (ht : Tendsto x atTop (ùìù (x k))) : ‚àÄ n ‚â• k, x n = x k := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let (x_n) be a convergent monotone sequence of real numbers. Suppose there exists k : ‚Ñï such that
    Tendsto x atTop (nhds (x k)). Show that x n = x k for all n ‚â• k. -/
theorem monotone_tendsto_eq_of_eq_term (x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (k : ‚Ñï) (hmono : Monotone x)
  (ht : Tendsto x atTop (nhds (x k))) : ‚àÄ n, n ‚â• k ‚Üí x n = x k := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-- Let (x_n) be a convergent monotone sequence of real numbers. Suppose there exists k : ‚Ñï such that
    Filter.Tendsto x Filter.atTop (Filter.nhds (x k)). Show that x n = x k for all n ‚â• k. -/
theorem monotone_tendsto_eq_of_eq_term (x : ‚Ñï ‚Üí ‚Ñù) (k : ‚Ñï) (hmono : Monotone x ‚à® Antitone x)
  (ht : Filter.Tendsto x Filter.atTop (Filter.nhds (x k))) : ‚àÄ n, n ‚â• k ‚Üí x n = x k := by sorry
